pageTitle: What is your Statutory Sick Pay end date?

sspEndDate.label: What is your Statutory Sick Pay end date?
sspEndDate.hint:
This might be different from the last date you were paid SSP.

It can be a date in the past or up to 3 months from today.

You can find this date on your SSP1 form. If you do not have an SSP1 form, you need to get this information from your employer.

For example, %s

errors.required: Enter your Statutory Sick Pay end date
errors.missingDay: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date must include a day
errors.missingMonth: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date must include a month
errors.missingYear: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date must include a year
errors.missingDayAndMonth: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date must include a day and a month
errors.missingDayAndYear: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date must include a day and a year
errors.missingMonthAndYear: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date must include a month and a year
errors.badFormatYear: Enter your Statutory Sick Pay end date with a year in the right format, for example 2001 not 01
errors.notReal: Enter a real Statutory Sick Pay end date
errors.notRealDigits: Enter a real Statutory Sick Pay end date using only digits
errors.outOfRange: Your Statutory Sick Pay end date cannot be more than 3 months in the future
